reason.raw: I'll rewrite some parts to make sure we capture all the use cases that we have discussed.
reason.html: I'll rewrite some parts to make sure we capture all the use cases that we have discussed.

description.raw:
It extends the communication model by checking if there's line of sight between the vehicles.

* If there's no line of sight caused by terrain, there's no communication.
* If the occlusion is caused by at least one wall, the wall penalty is applied. We don't know if there are other obstacles or more walls between the vehicles. However, the penalty for crossing a wall should be high enough that it doesn't matter what obstacles are after the wall, no communication either.
* If the occlusion is caused by at least one tree, the tree penalty is applied. I'm not 100% sure how the vegetation patches are going to work. Maybe we'll have to tweak this in the future because we cannot distinguish between crossing one or two tree lines.

This pull request requires pull request #16. [This is a better diff](#!/osrf/swarm/branches/compare/comms_model_part2%0Dadd_comms_model_caguero#diff) of the code added in part 2.

It extends the communication model by checking if there's line of sight between the vehicles.

  • If there's no line of sight caused by terrain, there's no communication.
  • If the occlusion is caused by at least one wall, the wall penalty is applied. We don't know if there are other obstacles or more walls between the vehicles. However, the penalty for crossing a wall should be high enough that it doesn't matter what obstacles are after the wall, no communication either.
  • If the occlusion is caused by at least one tree, the tree penalty is applied. I'm not 100% sure how the vegetation patches are going to work. Maybe we'll have to tweak this in the future because we cannot distinguish between crossing one or two tree lines.

This pull request requires pull request #16. This is a better diff of the code added in part 2.
